content: SECTION 1. EVEN START PROGRAMS OPERATED BY LOCAL EDUCATIONAL AGENCIES. Amendments to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 include providing educational skills to teenage parents, collecting data on participants' demographics, and expanding eligibility to pregnant teenagers, teenage parents, and their children. Amendments to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 now include expanding eligibility to pregnant teenagers, teenage parents, and their children. This involves amending paragraph (5) of section 1056(c) to include teenage parents in applications. Secondary school programs for basic skills improvement, dropout prevention, and reentry are addressed in this section. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to allocate 25 percent of funds to dropout prevention and reentry programs for pregnant teenagers and teenage parents. Additionally, funds can be used for services related to sex, race, or ethnicity. Applications for these programs are also amended. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to allocate funds for set-aside programs for pregnant teenagers and teenage parents, providing academic skills training, parenting classes, child care, health care, job training, and other support services. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 provides support services for pregnant teenagers and teenage parents, including academic skills training, parenting classes, child care, health care, job training, counseling services, scheduling flexibility, and referrals for community resources. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include support for pregnant teenagers and teenage parents in local targeted assistance programs, state and local plans, and drug abuse education programs. Assistance is provided to address school dropout programs. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to allocate at least 25 percent of funds for programs serving pregnant teenagers or teenage parents. Reporting requirements are updated to include age and sex demographics. SEC. 6. Assistance for basic skills improvement. Section 6106 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include assurances for set-aside programs for pregnant teenagers and teenage parents, such as academic skills training, parenting classes, child care, transportation, outreach programs, health care, job training, and other support services. The set-aside programs for pregnant teenagers and teenage parents include transportation, life skills training, mentor support, counseling services, scheduling flexibility, and referrals for community resources.
